taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek planis , wanderer, and –odes , resemblance, alluding to original assignment to another genus]

bio:treatment.discussion: Planodes virginicum has floated among Arabis, Cardamine, and Sibara. However, it is distinct from all three both morphologically and phylogenetically, and it appears to be most closely allied to Cardamine. It is known from Baja California; in the southeastern and some of the central United States, it has become weedy, especially in cultivated or abandoned fields.

references.reference: Rollins, R. C. 1947. Generic revisions in the Cruciferae: Sibara. Contr. Gray Herb. 165: 133–143.
